intro: Cotyledon rubrovenosa, commonly known as the red-veined cotyledon, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves with distinctive red veins, which are a striking characteristic of the species. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family. Its leaves are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Cotyledon rubrovenosa is popular as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
